{{Infobox musical artist |name = Nina Sky |image = NinaSky.jpg |caption = |image_size = |background = group_or_band |birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1984|3|13}} |birth_place = [[Queens, New York|Queens]], [[New York]], [[United States]] |genre = [[Hip hop music|Hip-hop]], [[Reggaeton]], [[contemporary R&B|R&B]], [[Dance-pop]] |years_active = 2004âpresent |label = [[Universal Music Group|Universal]] (2004â2007)
[[Polo Grounds Music|Polo Grounds]] / [[J Records|J]] (2007âpresent) |website = [http://www.ninaskyhigh.com www.ninaskyhigh.com] |associated_acts = [[Major Lazer]], [[Belly (rapper)|Belly]], [[The Alchemist (producer)|The Alchemist]], [[Tony Touch]], [[Rick Ross]], [[Prima J]], [[Kenza Farah]], [[Creep]] |current_members = Nicole Albino
Natalie Albino }} {{ external media | align = center | audio1 = You may listen to Nina Sky's '''"Move Ya Body"''' [http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lYbMvAB66KM&feature=related '''here''']. | audio2 = }} '''Nina Sky''' is an [[United States|American]] musical duo composed of [[identical twins]] '''Nicole''' and '''Natalie Albino''' (born March 13, 1984).[http://www.ninaskyhigh.com/blog/2011/03/the-birthday-rundown/ Nina Sky - Your Favorite Twins] ==Early life and career== Albino's parents moved to [[New York]] from [[Puerto Rico]] and were divorced when the girls were younger. They were born in [[Queens, New York|Queens]] and grew up in Astoria, New York in a place called Marine Terrace Because their stepfather worked as a DJ, the twins were influenced by different types of [[music]]. When the sisters were only 7 years old, they wrote their first song, "Sisters", and by the time they were 10, they already knew that they wanted to become singers.[http://www.everblazin.net/_artistes_detail.php?p=artistdetail&id=20 Artists] The twins' parents were very supportive of their daughters' ambitions. Their stepfather even gave them [[guitar]] and [[drum]] lessons. They were taken to [[audition]]s and, on some occasions, they even performed on some showcases. The sisters wanted to devise a name of their own. In using the first two [[syllable]]s of their names ("Ni" and "Na"), they came up with Nina. They then added Sky, which for them represented "the sky's the limit".[http://www.dominicantimes.com/news.php?nid=425 Dominican Times] ===2004â2006: ''Nina Sky''=== In 2004, The Jettsonz introduced the girls to [[Cipha Sounds]], a [[hip hop music|hip hop]] DJ under the [[Star Trak Entertainment|Star Trak label]] owned by [[The Neptunes]] ([[Pharrell]] and [[Chad Hugo]]). Cipha Sounds was impressed when he heard the girls sing and suggested that they use the "Coolie Dance" [[riddim]]. The twins then proceeded to write "Move Ya Body" (along with The Jettsonz, who also produced the record), mixing [[Caribbean]], R&B, and pop rhythms. Eventually, a [[Demo (music)|demo]] of the song was made. The demo fell into the hands of Eddie O'Loughlin, the president of Next Plateau Entertainment (which is a division of [[Universal Records]]). O'Loughlin signed the twins to a contract and they started working on their debut album. The single "[[Move Ya Body]]" was released on April 27, 2004 and reached number 17 on the [[Billboard Hot 100]] chart. Urban music and rhythmic top 40 stations quickly added the song to their play lists, sending the song up the charts. By July 17, "Move Ya Body" had gone to the top 5 on both sides of the Atlantic and had also reached the top 5 of a world combined R&B chart based on the US, UK, Germany, France and Australia. The song had also reached the top 50 of the Australian charts. On June 29, 2004 they released their first [[Nina Sky (album)|self-titled album]], featuring [[Betty Wright]].[http://music.yahoo.com/ar-308196---Nina-Sky Nina Sky on Yahoo] The twins, Natalie and Nicole continued to work and promote their music. They have contributed to the [[reggaeton]] movement with songs such as "[[Oye Mi Canto]]", and "[[MÃ¡s MaÃ­z]]" with artist and producer [[N.O.R.E.]] They were also featured artist on Sean Paul's song "Connection" from his album "The Trinity" ===2007âpresent: second album and ''The Other Side''=== [[Image:ninaskyphx.jpg|thumb|alt=Nina Sky performing at the Phoenix Pride Festival on 17 April 2010|Nina Sky performing at the Phoenix Pride Festival on 17 April 2010|right]] Nina Sky collaborated with French singer Kenza Farah for the song "Celle Qu'Il Te Faut", and was released in both French and English versions. The video was shot in New York. Nina Sky was recording on their second studio album, ''[[Starting Today]]''. The album was originally due on July 27, 2007. Producers include [[Stereotypes (producers)|Stereotypes]], Bruno & Phil, [[Neo da Matrix]], [[Ryan Leslie]], [[Salaam Remi]], and more. Guests include [[Rick Ross]] and others that have yet to be announced. In late 2007, Nina Sky left their label, Universal, and signed with [[Polo Grounds Music]]/[[J Records]]. Nina Sky have also put together remixes of popular songs including [[J. Holiday]]'s "[[Bed]]," [[Elliott Yamin]]'s "[[Wait For You]]", [[Cassidy (rapper)|Cassidy]]'s "[[My Drink n My 2 Step]], and [[The-Dream]]'s [[I Love Your Girl]]" They have also worked with Brooklyn MC [[Red Cafe]] on his street album ''The Co-Op'', and [[The Alchemist (producer)|The Alchemist]] on his song "Key To The City" Nina Sky recently appeared on [[Major Lazer]]'s album, [[Guns Don't Kill People... Lazers Do]]. They are currently in a battle with their record company [[Polo Grounds Music|Polo Grounds Records]], over the release of their new album "Starting Today". They have said they want to be released from their contract with the label because the label no longer supports them.http://neonlimelight.com/2010/03/11/nina-sky-ask-fans-to-help-them-get-out-of-record-contract/ In 2010, Nicole Albino revealed she was openly [[lesbian|homosexual]] and married female fashion designer, Erin Magee.http://www.inkedmag.com/inked-people/erin-magee.html The couple had dated since 2009; in an interview with ''Inked Magazine'', Magee revealed that she had her last name legally changed to Nicole's and had gotten a tattoo of the name across her right breast. With a new masculine (and as the public termed "butched up") style, the duo independently released an 8 track EP for digital download in August, entitled "The Other Side", which features production from [[DJ Yonny]], Salaam Remi, Kidz in the Hall & many more. A video for the lead-single, "[[You Ain't Got It (Funk That)]]" was also released. In early 2011 they worked with Creep on their song 'You'. On May 16, they released the music video on their official website.http://www.ninaskyhigh.com/blog/2011/05/video-premier-us-x-creep-you/?sms_ss=twitter&at_xt=4dd135a8af8c440d%2C0 They have recently confirmed that a new EP is in the works. ==Discography== {{Main|Nina Sky discography}} *''[[Nina Sky (album)|Nina Sky]]'' (2004) *''[[The Other Side (Nina Sky EP)|The Other Side]]'' (2010) *''Nina Sky's Second EP'' (2011) ==See also== {{Portal box|Puerto Rico|Biography}} *[[List of famous Puerto Ricans]] *[[List of twins]] {{clear}} ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.ninaskyhigh.com/ Official Website] * {{myspace|ninasky}} * {{twitter|ninasky}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Sky, Nina}} [[Category:1984 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:American female singers]] [[Category:Puerto Rican singers]] [[Category:Duos]] [[Category:Girl groups]] [[Category:Identical twins]] [[Category:People from Queens]] [[Category:American musicians of Puerto Rican descent]] [[Category:Sibling duos]] [[de:Nina Sky]] [[es:Nina Sky]] [[fa:ÙÛÙØ§ Ø§Ø³Ú©Ø§Û]] [[fr:Nina Sky]] [[it:Nina Sky]] [[sw:Nina Sky]] [[pl:Nina Sky]] [[fi:Nina Sky]]
